learning_objective: Describe choices made during program development using code comments, presentations, and demonstrations.
topic: Self-Assessment: Identifying Interests, Skills, and Values
question_str:
{
    "Question": "Alex is trying to develop a program for self-assessment that will help their peers identify their key interests, skills, and values. Alex wants to represent each characteristic as a boolean variable that is either true or false. Below is part of the code:\n\nboolean isInterestedInSports\nboolean isGoodAtMath\nboolean valuesTeamwork\n\nBased on this code snippet, which of the following comments would best help another programmer understand Alex's variable choices?",
    "Answer1": "// Boolean variables to store user's personal characteristics.",
    "Answer2": "// Variables represent whether a user is interested in sports, good at math, or values teamwork.",
    "Answer3": "// These variables store true or false values.",
    "Answer4": "// All these variables are booleans.",
    "CorrectAnswer": "2",
    "Explanation": "Although all options describe the variables to some extent, answer 2 gives the most context about what each variable specifically represents, which would help another programmer understand Alex's choices.",
    "code_snippet": "boolean isInterestedInSports\nboolean isGoodAtMath\nboolean valuesTeamwork"
}
